name: Bank Erosion Potential
functionStatement: Examines the role of bank processes and erosion in channel change. Observes patterns in sinuosity and curvature affecting habitat complexity.
descriptionMarkdown: Integrates bank geometry, rooting, surface protection, raw or failing banks, and hardening to summarize erosion risk and sediment delivery.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Score BEHI metrics (bank height ratio, rooting depth/density, angle, protection); map raw/slumping/undercut sections and percent eroding bank length; classify protection types; support with imagery.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Very high BEHI; >50% bankline eroding or failing; failing armor.
Criteria: Extensive bare/slumped banks and deteriorating protection.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Many long raw sections; high BEHI; widespread erosion.
Criteria: Large portions of bankline actively eroding or failing.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Patchy vegetation and moderate BEHI; some raw or slumping sections.
Criteria: Noticeable but limited eroding length.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Well-vegetated banks with low BEHI; few raw spots.
Criteria: Only small, scattered eroding segments that recover quickly.
